events.title: Start of the French Revolutionary Calendar
events.description: The French First Republic introduces the French Revolutionary Calendar, designed to remove religious and royalist influences from the calendar system.
events.significance: Represents an attempt to secularize and rationalize timekeeping during the revolutionary period.

events.title: First America's Cup Yacht Race
events.description: The yacht America wins the first race around the Isle of Wight, which later becomes known as the America's Cup.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the world's oldest international sporting trophy competition.

events.title: Japan Invades Manchuria
events.description: The Mukden Incident leads to Japan's invasion and occupation of northeastern China (Manchuria).
events.significance: A major prelude to the Pacific conflicts of World War II, escalating tensions in East Asia.

events.title: Ferdinand Marcos Declares Martial Law in the Philippines
events.description: President Ferdinand Marcos announces martial law in the Philippines, leading to authoritarian rule.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of a period of political repression and dictatorship in the Philippines.

events.title: U.S. and Cuba Announce Plans to Restore Diplomatic Relations
events.description: The U.S. and Cuba announce an agreement to normalize relations after more than 50 years of hostility.
events.significance: Signaled a major shift in U.S.-Cuba relations and opened the door for increased cooperation and dialogue.
